snippet.textDisplay:
"Take a dump on the toliet
Flush when you are finished up
I know I just said that
But it is still funny
I am almost back now
So I'll have to stop singing
And change my commentary
Back to the normal kind."

Sorry, have to think of that every time I hear this song, it makes it an even more memorable and good song IMO :D

snippet.textDisplay: Awesome song to a fantastic game. The best Zelda game... ever. And just to let you know, this game can be on the 3DS, thanks to Operation Moonfall! (Yeah, it's real btw.)

snippet.textDisplay: one of the most underrated games ever. Majora and Ocarina are both in their own way, some of the best games of all time. Ocarina will always be my favorite for the impact it had on me when I first popped it in, but both games hold a special place in my heart.
snippet.textOriginal: one of the most underrated games ever. Majora and Ocarina are both in their own way, some of the best games of all time. Ocarina will always be my favorite for the impact it had on me when I first popped it in, but both games hold a special place in my heart.

snippet.textDisplay: @AkumaUchitoru It...grows on you eh? :D I love this game but it was really boring when I was still new to it. snippet.textDisplay: In some ways Majora's Mask was better than Ocarina of Time because of so many unique things there were to do as every form of Link. The variety of side quests was great as well. A funny thing involving this game was that my brother would joke around and call Clock Town "Clockton."
snippet.textOriginal: In some ways Majora's Mask was better than Ocarina of Time because of so many unique things there were to do as every form of Link. The variety of side quests was great as well. A funny thing involving this game was that my brother would joke around and call Clock Town "Clockton."

Majora's Mask
A Link to the Past
Ocarina of Time (Would take 2nd if it weren't for the forced tutorials and Kaepora Gaebora)

snippet.textDisplay:
Thanks for posting this, I think too many people give this game the shaft unfairly but I think it's the 3rd best Zelda game behind Ocarina and the original Zelda. 

Majora's Mask wasn't even included in Nintendo's E3 Zelda retrospective and this game wasn't on Virtual Console until May 2009 while the first 4 Zelda console gamers were on virtual console by June 2007.
snippet.textOriginal:
Thanks for posting this, I think too many people give this game the shaft unfairly but I think it's the 3rd best Zelda game behind Ocarina and the original Zelda. 

Majora's Mask wasn't even included in Nintendo's E3 Zelda retrospective and this game wasn't on Virtual Console until May 2009 while the first 4 Zelda console gamers were on virtual console by June 2007.

snippet.textDisplay: @dissident93 compared to OOT, Wind Waker, Twilight Princess etc, yeah it was really confusing and difficult. To be honest though, I never played the really old NES games (ie: the first 2). I've been told Link's Adventure is astronomically harder
snippet.textOriginal: @dissident93 compared to OOT, Wind Waker, Twilight Princess etc, yeah it was really confusing and difficult. To be honest though, I never played the really old NES games (ie: the first 2). I've been told Link's Adventure is astronomically harder

snippet.textDisplay:
Welcome to scenic Clock Town!
If you head into South Clock Town, you can witness our amazing Clock Tower.
Heading towards West Clock Town will provide you with numerous shops for all your needs and pleasures.
Over in North Clock Town you can visit the Great Fairy of Clock Town, or perhaps play on the playground!
Finally, we have East Clock Town with the prized Stock Pot Inn and mini games as well as the Mayor's Offce!
Ignore the the impending death from above and enjoy your stay!
snippet.textOriginal:
Welcome to scenic Clock Town!
If you head into South Clock Town, you can witness our amazing Clock Tower.
Heading towards West Clock Town will provide you with numerous shops for all your needs and pleasures.
Over in North Clock Town you can visit the Great Fairy of Clock Town, or perhaps play on the playground!
Finally, we have East Clock Town with the prized Stock Pot Inn and mini games as well as the Mayor's Offce!
Ignore the the impending death from above and enjoy your stay!

snippet.textDisplay: Let's see if Nintendo decides to release this game on the 3DS, hopefully they do. If I had to say one thing MM did very well, it's this main town. It felt very alive thanks to all of its people having their own unique scheduled activities and﻿ stories. The first time I heard this theme, it immediately reminded me of Suikoden II which I had just finished.
snippet.textOriginal: Let's see if Nintendo decides to release this game on the 3DS, hopefully they do. If I had to say one thing MM did very well, it's this main town. It felt very alive thanks to all of its people having their own unique scheduled activities and﻿ stories. The first time I heard this theme, it immediately reminded me of Suikoden II which I had just finished.
